title: Chapter 1281 - Who Asked You About Fairness?
body:
Chapter 1281 - Who Asked You About Fairness?

The palace interior was vast and empty. There was no furniture or decorations at all, save for the eternally lit bronze lanterns on the walls.

As soon as Su Yi entered, the gates slammed shut behind him.

He was instantly on guard, and he scanned his surroundings. 

A man sat cross-legged on the ground at the far end of the hall. He was dressed in gray robes, with coarse, firm features. Even seated, he was built like a mountain, with an imposing martial bearing.

Wei Shan!

Su Yi’s eyes narrowed, and ripples coursed through his heart.

He’d considered all sorts of possibilities. The only thing that never occurred to him was that he’d see Wei Shan the moment he entered this mysterious immortal palace.

But Su Yi quickly realized that something was amiss.

Wei Shan was seated cross-legged, but it seemed he’d lost his awareness. He was like an unmoving clay statue.

“Shen Mu, you’re finally here.”

A cold, tranquil voice suddenly rang out.

A rain of light flowed through the air, outlining a human figure.

She wore a pale green dress, with a jade belt around her waist. Her long hair was tied up and decorated with a golden crown. 

She gripped a black scepter, and her features were picturesque, pretty,...
original_title: Chapter 1281 - Who Asked You About Fairness?
